Answer: C: His stance blends cost awareness with access: he is conscientious about fees and courthouse expenses, yet personally reviews waivers to preserve access to justice, as shots of the WSIL 3 set show him explaining the process. He ties that philosophy to practice by streamlining divorces and custody matters and acknowledging that an additional judge can improve throughput under a heavy caseload. The evolution is from principles to concrete management steps.

The speaker talks about his stance on cost awareness and access to justice. He mentions reviewing fee-waiver requests and streamlining heavy family-law dockets to shorten case length. He also acknowledges that adding a sixth judge will help move cases along.
